bioghist.p: The Sanborn Map Company Insurance Maps of Philadelphia consist of a uniform series of large-scale maps, depicting the commercial, industrial, and residential sections of Philadelphia. The maps were designed to assist fire insurance agents in determining the degree of hazard associated with a particular property and therefore show the size, shape, and construction of dwellings, commercial buildings, and factories as well as fire walls, locations of windows and doors, sprinkler systems, and types of roofs. The maps also indicate widths and names of streets, property boundaries, building use, and house and block numbers. They show the locations of water mains, giving their dimensions, and of fire alarm boxes and hydrants.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Sanborn Map Company Insurance Maps of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania volumes. Volumes include: 1916-2004 set: original Philadelphia volumes, with all updates through 2004; 1958 set for Philadelphia; 1956-1967 set for Philadelphia; and volumes, mostly from the 1960s (1956-1967), for Chester County, Delaware County, Montgomery County, Berwyn, Conshohocken, Willow Grove, Camden (New Jersey). The collection also includes microfilm for several sets held by the Library of Congress and others covering Pennsylvania, Delaware, New Jersey, and Maryland; punch cards with microfilm shots of the changes to pages in the Philadelphia volumes, 1980-2002; and digital updates for 2005/2006 and 2007.
